title: UH Systemwide Policies and Procedures Information System (PPIS)
content: This is the repository for Policies and Procedures for the University of Hawaii and related information.  You may browse through the different sections: Board of Regent Policies, Executive Policies, Administrative Procedures. View all of the Policies and Procedures by title or number. Enter a Policy/Procedure by number: View Policy (e.g. EP1.100)

section: Public Safety and Emergency Management Plans

title: UH Systemwide Policies and Procedures Information System (PPIS)

sections.title: Public Safety and Emergency Management Plans

title: UH Faculty/Staff Directory
description: Search directory by name, department, etc.
usage_restrictions: This directory is intended solely to provide contact information for individual members of the University community. Information obtained from this directory may not be used for the purpose of bulk communication of any kind to students, faculty and/or staff. This includes solicitations of any kind or informational announcements using paper, email, or phone calls. Violations may be addressed under all applicable policies, codes of conduct or law.
alternative_format_info: If required, information contained on this website can be made available in an alternative format upon request.

title: University of Hawaiʻi EEO Policies
content: The Office of EEO/TIX develops and maintains Executive, Systemwide and Mānoa policies and procedures. We promote the implementation of these policies by conducting workshops, providing online training, providing advice and resources on the disability accommodation process, and through the investigation and resolution of complaints.

title: Nondiscrimination
content: It is the policy of the university to provide equity of opportunity in higher education, both in the educational mission and as an employer. The university is committed to comply with all State and Federal statutes, rules, and regulations which prohibit discrimination. The university is committed to a policy of nondiscrimination on the basis of race, sex, gender identity and expression, age, religion, color, national origin (including shared ancestry and ethnic characteristics), ancestry, citizenship, disability, genetic information, marital status, breastfeeding, income assignment for child support, arrest and court record (except as permissible under State law), sexual orientation, national guard absence, or status as a covered veteran.

title: Sex Discrimination & Sexual Harassment
content: The policy defines prohibited discrimination and harassment and provides specific examples.

title: Sexual Assault, Domestic Violence, Dating Violence, and Stalking
content: The University of Hawaiʻi is committed to creating a community free from intimidation, harassment and violence. Sexual assault is prohibited by law and is a serious offense that violates the basic standards of behavior expected of members of the university community. The university will not tolerate acts of sexual assault. This includes domestic violence, dating violence, and stalking. The university will take appropriate action to prevent sexual assault and will correct and discipline behavior that is found to violate this policy.

title: Consensual Relationships
content: The University of Hawaiʻi is committed to ensuring a safe, civil, working environment in which the dignity of every individual is recognized and respected. All members of the University share equal responsibility in this regard. All relationships between University employees and its students adhere to principles of professionalism, integrity, mutual trust, and respect. The Policy on Consensual Relationships takes a best-practice approach in recognizing and managing consensual relationships, while also balancing the privacy interests of individuals and supporting the values, mission and goals of our university. In particular, this policy will help our campuses remain free from real or perceived conflicts when individuals in positions of unequal power are involved in consensual romantic, dating or sexual relationships. Power is unequal when one individual in a relationship has direct supervision, direction, instruction, oversight, evaluation, advisement or substantial influence over the employment or educational status of another.

title: Disability Information
content: All university programs and activities should be available to persons with disabilities. Title II of the Americans with Disabilities Act states: “A public entity shall furnish appropriate auxiliary aids and services where necessary to afford an individual with a disability an equal opportunity to participate in, and enjoy the benefits of, a service, program, or activity conducted by a public entity.”

title: Recruitment and Hiring
content: For guidelines on recruitment and EEO in the hiring process, see Administrative Procedure AP 9.540 – Recruitment and Selection Procedures for APT and Faculty

UH System » Emergency

There is no emergency at this time.  

In the event of an emergency, this page will provide information about the incident, how to remain safe and when status has returned to normal.

When appropriate, the university will alert faculty, staff and students via email, text messaging and/or UH Alert. Information will also be provided through campus webpages and local news media.

Sign Up Now for UH Alerts

Alerts by email and text messaging for faculty, staff and students.

Reporting an Emergency

Call 911
Use a campus emergency phone, if available
Contact campus security or the emergency number for your campus

Support and Intervention

Everyone’s struggle is different. If you or someone you know are experiencing distress or a painful emotion and need support, here is a list of contacts:

National Suicide Prevention Lifeline (NSPL) – 24/7 crisis line 1-800-273-TALK (8255)
Crisis Text Line – 24/7 crisis line text “Aloha” or “Start” to 741741
Hawaii CARES (formerly Crisis Line of Hawaiʻi) – On Oʻahu (808) 832-3100; Toll free for neighbor islands 1-800-753-6879

Preparing for an Emergency

Download Homeowner’s Handbook to Prepare for Natural Hazards, a UH Sea Grant College Program book
Emergency information, from putting together a supply kit to a list of evacuation shelters, can be found on the Hawaiʻi Emergency Management Agency website.

Novel Coronavirus

Novel Coronavirus Information

Contact Us

For corrections or updates to the contents of this page, please email ur@hawaii.edu.

Last modified: July 30, 2025

# Our 10 Campuses Across the Hawaiian Islands

## [UH News](https://www.hawaii.edu/news/)

### [UH sets extramural funding record for 4th consecutive year, $734M in FY 2025](https://www.hawaii.edu/news/2025/08/06/extramural-funding-record-fy25/)

Extramural funding includes investments from external agencies such as the federal government, industry and nonprofit organizations.

### [Chancellor Benham to step down from UH West Oʻahu](https://www.hawaii.edu/news/2025/08/04/chancellor-benham-to-step-down-from-uhwo/)

Benham steps down after nearly a decade of anchoring the campus in a culture of engaged scholarship and service rooted in Native Hawaiian values.

## Our 10 campuses

Founded in 1907, the University of Hawaiʻi System includes 3 universities, 7 [community colleges](http://uhcc.hawaii.edu/) and [community-based learning centers](http://www.hawaii.edu/campuses/learning-centers/) across Hawaiʻi. As the state’s public system of higher education, UH offers opportunities as unique and diverse as our island home.

title: Privacy Statement
text:
The University of Hawaiʻi (the “University”) is committed to protecting the privacy and accuracy of confidential information to the extent possible, subject to provisions of state and federal law.

This Privacy Statement discloses the privacy practices for [www.hawaii.edu](https://www.hawaii.edu/), the main University of Hawaiʻi System website (this “Website”). By using this Website, you are consenting to our collection and use of information in accordance with this Privacy Statement. If you do not agree with this Privacy Statement, please do not use this website.

Please note that websites for schools, centers, departments and other units within the University of Hawaiʻi system may have their own privacy statements. You should review the privacy statement posted on other University of Hawaiʻi websites when you visit them.

## What personal information do we collect?

This Website may collect usage information including the following:

  * Internet Protocol (IP) address of computer being used or other unique identifier for your computer, mobile device, or other technology used to access the Website;
  * Web pages requested
  * Referring web page
  * Browser used
  * Operating system used
  * Date and time
  * Length of visit
  * Websites you visited immediately prior to this Website.


The usage information and device identifiers are used to update and refresh University websites, and identify repeat users, to enhance your online experience and tailor content to your interests. Such usage information is typically non-identifying; and, if such usage information becomes identifying, it is treated as personally identifiable information (“PII”).

This Website may also collect PII that you provide to us including the following:

  * First and Last name
  * Email address
  * Phone number


## How do we collect information?

### Cookies

This Website uses “cookies” in order to deliver web content specific to individual users’ interests, to understand and save your preferences for future visits, or to keep track of online purchasing transactions. Cookies are small files that are stored on a user’s computer. Cookies are used to recall your specific information on subsequent website visits, simplifying the process of recording your information, allowing you to use customized features, and serving as a convenience feature to save you time.

Cookie settings can be adjusted in your browser and users can instruct their browsers to refuse all cookies entirely. If you choose to decline cookies, you may not be able to fully experience the interactive features of Website as there may be certain features that are only available through the use of cookies.

### Google Analytics

This Website uses a tool called Google Analytics to collect information about the use of this site. For information on how Google Analytics handles user data, see Google’s privacy policy: <https://policies.google.com/technologies/partner-sites>. You can prevent Google Analytics from recognizing you on return visits to this site by disabling cookies on your browser.

### Web forms

This Website may collect information through the use of web forms. These forms may require you to provide information such as contact information when completing the form.

## How do we use the collected information?

**Communication.** The University may use information collected from this Website for the purpose of communication back to individuals who contact us via the site.

**Improving This Website.** The University may use browser-IP-address information and anonymous-browser history to report information about site accesses and for profiling purposes. This information is used to improve Web presentation and utilization. IP address information may also be used for troubleshooting purposes.

**Providing a Service.** The University may use the information you provide us for the performance of a service you have requested.

## How is collected information shared with others?

  * The University will not sell personal information collected by this Website to third-party organizations.
  * The University will not disclose, without your consent, personal information collected about you by this Website, except for certain explicit circumstances in which disclosure is required by law.
  * The University may share information that does not personally identify you without restriction.


## What if you are located in the European Economic Area?

If you are located in the European Economic Area, please visit <https://www.hawaii.edu/uhdatagov/GDPR_Privacy_Notice_10.4.18_Accessible.pdf> for additional information about ways that the University of Hawaiʻi, including this website, may process your personal data and your rights regarding your personal data under the General Data Protection Regulation (“GDPR”).

## What happens if the privacy statement changes?

This Privacy Statement was last revised in May 2022. We may change this Privacy Statement at any time and for any reason. We encourage you to review this Privacy Statement each time you visit the website.

## What about privacy on other websites?

This website may contain links to other websites. Some of those websites may be operated by third parties. We provide the links for your convenience, but we do not review, control, or monitor the privacy practices of websites operated by others.

We are not responsible for the performance of websites operated by third parties or for your business dealings with them. You are solely responsible for reviewing the privacy statements for any linked external websites to understand how those websites may collect, use, and share your information. Therefore, whenever you leave this website we recommend that you review each website’s privacy practices and make your own conclusions regarding the adequacy of these practices.

## How to contact us?

If you have questions or comments about this Privacy Statement, please contact us by visiting this page on our website: <https://www.hawaii.edu/contact/>
